Case reference: 2012020004.CaseDesc: Jafar Imenpour, 74 years of age, who was visiting the Lower Mainland area of British Columbia from Iran, was reported missing on September 25, 2011.  Mr. Imenpour had not returned to his family residence after he had left for a 15 minute walk in Port Coquitlam, B.C. He does not speak English and does not know anyone other than his family in this area.

Case reference: 2005007099.CaseDesc: On June 27, 1982, an unidentified man was recovered from the Maid of the Mist pool in the Niagara River. His age was estimated to be between 25-50 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 192-195 lbs and his length was measured at 5'9"-5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: His teeth contain both amalgam and composite resin fillings.
Scar: Right Side Of Head, He had previous brain surgery (craniotomy) on the right side of his head.

Case reference: 2012020085.CaseDesc: Benjamin Entz was born and raised on the Waldeck Hutterite Colony near Waldeck, SK and resided there up until the time he went missing. He was described by friends and family as being a loner who kept to himself. Mr. Entz left the colony on the evening of 2011-09-18 at which time he was seen driving away on a tractor which was later recovered the following day. The investigation/search for Mr. Entz has involved numerous witness interviews, air and ground searches, and media releases, however he has yet to be located.

Case reference: 2023005753.CaseDesc: On January 1,1970, Anne Moran was last seen by her husband in their residence in Toronto, Ontario.  It was believed by her family that her husband reported her missing however no report can be located.  Her husband has since passed away.

Case reference: 2014006037.CaseDesc: On March 21, 2013, Bruno Pouliot went to a medical appointment. Later that evening, Bruno was last seen in a pharmacy located in Saint-Pierre-de-l’île-d’Orléans, Québec. Bruno lived in the Donnacona area and was known to go snowshoeing on the frozen St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2013000039.CaseDesc:
Darryl Ferneyhough went missing on the morning of Sunday, May 13, 2001. Darryl was seen at the
night club NRG on Gottingen Street at 1:30 a.m. and later seen at 3:40 a.m. running north on Gottingen Street in the area of the Marquee Club.

Case reference: 2014002260.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1993, William Kacuiba was operating a snow machine on the North Saskatchewan river near Prince Albert, SK. His snow machine went through open ice and searches of the water and area, including air searches, failed to locate his body.

Pants: Black, snowmobile; possible yellow stripe down the sides
Scar: Left Hand, 1.5 cm scar on back of 2nd and 3rd finger
Left Wrist, 2 cm scar on the back of the wrist

Case reference: 2006025799.CaseDesc: Anthony Roberts was last seen driving his vehicle east on King Street in Prescott, Ontario, on January 8, 1996. He was reported missing on January 19, 1996, and has not been heard from or seen since that time.

Case reference: 2019048180.CaseDesc: On August, 11, 2019, Miranda Belle was seen for the last time by her ex-spouse at a family gathering in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Miranda was last heard from via Facebook, on August 17, 2019.

Case reference: 2014038580.CaseDesc: The skeletal remains a young adult male were found in September 1995 by hunters in the Terrace Creek area near Kelowna, British Columbia. The unidentified male wore distinctive jewelry and is likely to have died at least 10 years before his remains were found.

Case reference: 2022036931.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2022, Keith Zajac was seen for the last time in Brandon, Manitoba. During the time of his disappearance, Keith was traveling from Squamish, British Columbia to Ontario. That same day, his vehicle was located near Highway 1, approximately 10 kilometers west of Brandon. Several witnesses reported seeing Keith walking along the highway, westbound on the Assiniboine River's edge.

Hair: Blonde, Other, Hair shaved to one quarter; blonde, greying
Teeth: Left upper inciser broken and looks smaller

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Shoes: Black, sandals; velcro straps; size 9; navy blue, grey and black swirls
Backpack: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Mountain Equipment Coop
Glasses: Bronze, octagon shaped, wire rimmed, prescription

Case reference: 2018039302.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1992, at approximately 9:00 am, Glen Levy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to his disappearance, Glen had attempted to travel by bus to visit his father in Florida, USA.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Parka, green trim, 3/4 length

Case reference: 2014002584.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1989, Carlo Dentoni was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Carlo sold antiques and travelled regularly to Italy. He completed his post-secondary education at universities in Calgary and England.

Case reference: 2020040144.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1950, Mabel Crumback was seen for the last time at approximately 12:30 am at her home located in Toronto, Ontario. Mabel had been babysitting her younger brother while her family was out of town. The following morning, she was gone.

Case reference: 2013000022.CaseDesc: Mr. Shenchiu "Andy" Tsou was last seen at the Halifax Casino on June 26, 2005. He was known as a regular client at the Casino. Mr. Tsou was travelling from Richmond BC.

Case reference: 2005005199.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1988, an unidentified man was discovered in a creek near Cushman Road in St. Catharines, Ontario. A black plastic comb was found in his pocket, as well as a Salvation Army registration card with the name ‘Roscoe Echo (21JUNE1923, Place of Birth: New York City).

Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, silver band
Shirt: White, Button up with red stripes

Case reference: 2016017728.CaseDesc: Reid Chesney left a men's shelter in Halifax, Nova Scotia on April 4, 2016. Mr. Chesney lived a transient lifestyle and had very little communication with family members. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006012999.CaseDesc: Joshua Kennet was last seen in the water after the boat he was riding in overturned on Grayson Lake, Ontario on October 13, 1995. Joshua is presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014006186.CaseDesc: In 2003, Jack Gichuru Gatari last spoke to his sister and told her he was going to Toronto, Ontario, to find work. Jack had come to Canada in 1999 on a student visa to attend the University of Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2021011416.CaseDesc: On March 25, 2021, Solange Bergeron was seen for the last time as she was drifting uncontrollably in the St. Lawrence River, near the Laviolette Park, in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance, Solange was despondent.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Straight, Long and straight

Case reference: 2016069130.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1969, the remains of a male were recovered from the Mattagami River, north of the bridge which crosses between Timmins and Mountjoy township. His post-mortem length was 5'6" to 5'7" and his weight at autopsy was recorded at 145 lbs., however these measurements may not be an accurate reflection of his living height and weight.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were absent with the exception of three anterior teeth.

Case reference: 2016008144.CaseDesc: Ben Trommels was last seen at his residence after being dropped off at 6:00 p.m. on Thursday, February 11, 2016.  It is believed that he left his apartment on foot that evening.  Ben suffers from mental health issues.

Hair: Brown, often has a shaved head
Coat: Black, winter; with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2013000128.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1990, Delphine Nikal was left in the care of her uncle. At approximately 2:00 pm Delphine advised her uncle she was going to meet her three girlfriends in Smithers BC (approx 16 km. away).  Delphine hitchhiked to Smithers and met up with her friends. At approximately 10:00 pm Delphine called her uncle to tell him that she was on her way home from Smithers. She was last seen by her two friends hitchhiking in the east bound lane of Hwy #16.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, Light bleached with white pocket sewn on inside, Levi's
Purse: Leather, Black, Pouch style containing hair spray, brush, pictures, make up, address book
Pants: Denim, Pink, Described as a hot pink and tight to the leg. Knee length

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014003922.CaseDesc: On Saturday July 15, 1972, Mr. Zukewhich and a friend took a canoe on to Clearwater Lake. Witnesses state that both men were under the influence of alcohol and that they took alcohol with them into the canoe. Witnesses further noted that the lake was extremely rough due to high winds. Mr. Zukewhich and friend were seen departing around 1600 hrs heading towards an area known as Long Point. A resident of Long Point advised police he observed one person in the red canoe which was sitting flat indicating weight in the front. The canoe was recovered on July 17th. Despite extensive searching, Mr. Zukewhich was never located.

Case reference: 2014002183.CaseDesc: On July 1st, 1979, John Wong was seen for the last time leaving the area of the Grace Gospel Church in Niagara Falls, Ontario. His vehicle was located on Portage Road in close proximity to the Niagara River. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2006012799.CaseDesc: John Crofts last resided in a retirement home on Yearly Road in Huntsville. He was last seen in the Huntsville area on December 25, 1997.

Case reference: 2012020176.CaseDesc: This adult male was found in Vancouver rooming house.

Case reference: 2014003573.CaseDesc: On October 11, 1978, George Greyeyes left from Petersfield, Manitoba on a hunting trip. He left by canoe and was supposed to return that same day. Water conditions were poor with high winds and waves. On October 12, 1978, he had not yet returned and was reported missing to police. Searches were conducted and he was never located. Mr. Greyeyes is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014002740.CaseDesc: On November 17th, 1997, Ferdinand Dauz was last seen in New Westminster British Columbia.  Mr. Dauz was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003978.CaseDesc: Ernest Robert Pfaff left home at approximately 8pm on December 31, 1973 to purchase a loaf of bread.  He was driving a 1972 Ford Maverick, light blue in colour, with red pin stripes on the sides.

Case reference: 2014005505.CaseDesc: Forrest Schab was last seen on August 13th 2010 in Mexico City, Mexico.

Case reference: 2020011471.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, at approximately 9:00 am, Stella Zayats was last seen by her husband as she left her residence to go for a walk in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2020010761.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1983, at approximately 11:00am, Rudolf Jakob was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shirt: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Striped; Light blue and dark blue

Case reference: 2016006283.CaseDesc: Larry LEGACY was reported missing on March 22, 1993 when friends and family had not heard from him in several weeks. He was last known to reside in Edmonton, Alberta, but also frequented the Round Hill area, southeast of Edmonton. He also frequently traveled to Calgary, Alberta and to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2014003765.CaseDesc: Mr. Hicks walked away from his temporary residence during the morning of August 11, 1994, leaving his wallet behind. He never returned. Neil is believed to suffer from mental health issues and was prescribed medication.

Case reference: 2014005273.CaseDesc: Elaine Frieda Alook was last seen on May 11, 2004, on Tower road, outside of Fort McMurray, Alberta.

Scar: Lower Back, She had a cast from her wrist to elbow on her left arm

Case reference: 2014001312.CaseDesc: John McAllister was last seen leaving his home on May 7, 1973. Mr. McAllister's truck was found near Lodgepole, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004248.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1979, at approximately 5:00 a.m., Myrna Montgrand was seen for the last time outside of a residence in La Loche, Saskatchewan. Earlier that morning, Myrna had been with a group of people at a party.

Case reference: 2014002117.CaseDesc: On January 13, 1996, Michelle HARMER was reported missing by an acquaintance of the family who last spoke with her on October 31, 1995. The last contact Michelle's family had with her was in early November 1995.

Case reference: 2014003239.CaseDesc: Craig Rain was last seen at a gas station at Range Road 32 and Highway 16 north of Duffield, Alberta. He had been planning to hitch hike into Edmonton, Alberta, from this location.
